content: Among nephrologists (kidney doctors) worldwide, it is considered the most recommended initial and long-term therapy. PD is generally performed every day, either manually during the day or at night, with the help of a cycler machine. PD uses your own abdomen (belly) lining to help remove the waste buildup. This is done with a solution known as dialysate. Instead of using needles, a surgically placed tube called a catheter is used to pass dialysate in and out of the abdomen. This soft and flexible catheter, approximately the width of a pencil, can be discreetly hidden under clothing while going about daily activities.
